data.title: The 60+ Best Pierce Brosnan Movies
data.meta_description: Over 600 filmgoers have voted on the 60+ Best Pierce Brosnan Movies. Current Top 3: GoldenEye, The Thomas Crown Affair, Tomorrow Never Dies
data.text:
Ranked By

3.3K votes

668 voters

3 reranks

Voting Rules

Vote for your favorite movies, regardless of critic reviews or how big the role was.

With over 650 movie fans having cast their votes, this list of the best Pierce Brosnan movies is sure to please all kinds of film buffs. From suave secret agents to daring action heroes, Pierce Brosnan has played it all - and he's done it with aplomb. His immense charisma and natural charm have made him one of Hollywood's most beloved leading men since his breakout role as James Bond in 1995's GoldenEye.

Brosnan has been part of some legendary films throughout his career, from rom-coms like The Thomas Crown Affair and Mamma Mia! to thrilling action flicks such as The World Is Not Enough and Die Another Day. He's even managed to mix things up with roles in musicals like Mamma Mia! Here We Go Again, proving there isn't a genre he can't tackle with ease.

Whether you're looking for something lighthearted or an edge-of-your-seat adventure flick, the best Pierce Brosnan movies are guaranteed to keep you entertained for hours on end. So why not peruse our rankings below? Vote up your favorites and enjoy the show.

Most divisive: Quest for Camelot

Over 600 Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The 60+ Best Pierce Brosnan Movies

Pierce Brosnan, Sean Bean, Izabella Scorupco

Released : 1995

Directed by : Martin Campbell

For Fans Of: Action, Adventure, Thriller

Reasons to Watch if you Love Pierce Brosnan: The first of four times Brosnan donned the iconic tuxedo as James Bond 007, GoldenEye revitalized the franchise with its thrilling action sequences, memorable villains, and Brosnan's perfect blend of charm, wit, and lethal prowess. As one of the most beloved Bonds in history, this film is a must-watch for any fan wishing to witness his captivating introduction to the iconic role.

In GoldenEye, James Bond (Pierce Brosnan) returns, tasked with halting a lethal satellite weapon system from falling into the wrong hands. Aided by CIA agent Jack Wade (Joe Don Baker) and computer whiz Boris Grishenko (Alan Cumming), Bond navigates a world of treachery, betrayal, and high-tech espionage. The film, notable for its thrilling action scenes and introduction of Judi Dench as M, marked Brosnan's debut as the iconic British spy. With its blend of classic Bond charm and modern sensibilities, GoldenEye revitalized the franchise for a new era.

Released : 1999

Directed by : John McTiernan

For Fans Of: Crime, Romance, Thriller

Reasons to Watch if you Love Pierce Brosnan: Brosnan's suave demeanor and devilish charm are on full display as he plays a debonair billionaire art thief caught in a cat-and-mouse game with an ambitious insurance investigator (Rene Russo). This stylish, sexy crime caper showcases the magnetic chemistry between Brosnan and Russo, making it an irresistible watch for fans of the actor's charisma.

Bored billionaire Thomas Crown (Pierce Brosnan) decides to entertain himself by stealing a Monet from a reputed museum. When Catherine Banning (Rene Russo), an investigator for the museum's insurance company, takes an interest in Crown, a complicated back-and-forth game with romantic undertones begins between them. In an attempt to find out where Banning's loyalties lie, Crown returns the painting and essentially turns himself in, hoping that Banning's feelings for him will lead to an escape.

Pierce Brosnan, Jonathan Pryce, Michelle Yeoh

Released : 1997

Directed by : Roger Spottiswoode

For Fans Of: Action, Adventure, Thriller

Reasons to Watch if you Love Pierce Brosnan: In his second outing as James Bond, Brosnan continues to deliver an effortlessly cool performance as he battles a media mogul bent on starting World War III. With breathtaking stunts, high-tech gadgets, and fantastic chemistry between Brosnan and co-star Michelle Yeoh, this action-packed sequel offers another thrilling ride for admirers of his portrayal as 007.

Media mogul Elliot Carver (Jonathan Pryce) wants his news empire to reach every country on the globe, but the Chinese government will not allow him to broadcast there. Carver doesn't take no for an answer and plans to use his media empire to fuel flames of war between the Western world and China. Thankfully, James Bond (Pierce Brosnan) is on to the insane news tycoon and travels to China to stop him with the help of Chinese secret agent Wai Lin (Michelle Yeoh).

Released : 1999

Directed by : Michael Apted

For Fans Of: Action, Adventure, Thriller

Reasons to Watch if you Love Pierce Brosnan: Diving deeper into Bond's emotional complexity while maintaining his signature charm and lethal skills, this third installment gives fans more insight into what makes the character tick. From exhilarating boat chases along London's Thames River to intense confrontations with treacherous allies (Sophie Marceau), Brosnan once again proves why he's among the best actors to have played 007.

Bond (Pierce Brosnan) must race to defuse an international power struggle with the world's oil supply hanging in the balance. Elektra King (Sophie Marceau), is the daughter of a murdered oil tycoon whom Bond is assigned to protect. The villain is Renard (Robert Carlyle), who has a bullet lodged in his brain rendering him unable to feel pain. Also featuring nuclear weapons expert Dr. Christmas Jones (Denise Richards).

Pierce Brosnan, Linda Hamilton, Charles Hallahan

Released : 1997

Directed by : Roger Donaldson

For Fans Of: Action, Adventure, Drama

Reasons to Watch if you Love Pierce Brosnan: Stepping away from Bond, Brosnan showcases his versatility as an actor by playing a volcanologist racing against time to save an idyllic small town from a catastrophic volcanic eruption. Combining thrilling action with heartfelt human drama, this disaster film highlights Brosnan's compelling screen presence in a more vulnerable and heroic role.

Volcanologist Harry Dalton (Pierce Brosnan) and Mayor Rachel Wando (Linda Hamilton), finally convince the unbelieving populace that the big one is about to hit and that they need to evacuate immediately, only to discover her two children have gone up the mountain to get their grandmother. With Earth's clock racing against them, they must rescue the kids and grandma before the volcano explodes in a fury of flame and ash a million times more powerful than an atomic bomb.

Ewan McGregor, Pierce Brosnan, Kim Cattrall

Released : 2010

Directed by : Roman Polanski

For Fans Of: Mystery, Thriller, Drama

Reasons to Watch if you Love Pierce Brosnan: In this atmospheric political thriller directed by Roman Polanski, Brosnan shines as a former British Prime Minister struggling with the release of his controversial memoirs. Steeped in conspiracy and suspense, it's a fascinating watch for those drawn to his intense and layered performances.

When a successful ghostwriter, the Ghost (Pierce Brosnan), agrees to finish the memoirs of Adam Long (Ewan McGregor), England's former prime minister, his publisher assures him it's the chance of a lifetime. Instead, he begins to uncover evidence that suggests his late predecessor knew a dark secret about Lang and may have been murdered to prevent it from coming to light.
